rComments: Professor Siemiatycki has three children. His two human ones, and this course. Most people will get the Siemiatycki experience through GGR271 and hate it, and some will take this Infrastructure course with him and absolutely love it. Hes so passionate about his work and it shows and makes for one of the best courses Ive taken in university.

The course content itself was relatively dry, but he managed to keep everyone interested (mostly). His own research was often discussed throughout the course, which was genuinely fascinating and helped apply real-world examples to the topics we were exploring. I know some students struggled, but if you at least do the readings then you'll be okay.
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', 'Lecture heavy', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Professor Matti is one of my fav profs at UofT. He's so sweet and genuinely cares about his students doing well. He is always open to office hours and is very responsive to emails. He's a fair grader and while he doesn't give a specific review for the midterms/finals, if you pay attention in lecture, you will do well!

Very little feedback on assignments/tests, and you are expected to know things that aren't covered in lecture. Make sure you OK everything with a TA before handing it in, or else many of your theories/assumptions may be seen as false/inadequate. Readings are incredibly dull, and take quite a bit of time. Expectations are too high for a 200 course.
teacherRatingTags: ['Graded by few things', 'Lots of homework', 'Tough grader']

rComments: His grading is hyper-critical. He grades your papers as if you, an undergrad, are a post-graduate. He does not leave good feedback on papers so you have no clue on how to improve. He was not very accessible outside of class for questions. Lectures were interesting at least. I would not recommend his class unless it is mandatory.

He concentrates more on language and expression but not what we actually learn from class. When I asked for review of my paper, he refused to do it, just because that he thought the TA objectively marked our paper, so I cannot find the problems of my paper.
Good Professor. Easy to understand and knowledgeable.

A very tough marker that is very unclear about grading criteria. Students only received an A on their assignments if they did extra research. However, before grading our assignments, he never mentioned anything about extra research. His feedback on assignments is very shallow and unhelpful. He is very difficult to talk to and is rather smug.
